intro: Polygala mandonii, commonly known as the Mandon's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, and it produces small, bean-like pods that contain seeds. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
